prompt: "Every swan I've ever seen is white. Therefore, all swans are white." What type of reasoning is this?
hint: We're going from specific observations to a general conclusion.
explanation: This is inductive generalization - drawing a general conclusion from specific observations. Note: This was a famous example of how induction can fail! Black swans were eventually discovered in Australia, proving the conclusion wrong despite many observations.
visual_concept: Inductive Generalization: Seeing many white dots and concluding ALL dots must be white, even those you haven't seen yet.
